Every such silencer, expansion chamber or other contrivance shall at all times while the vehicle is used on a road be maintained in good and efficient working order, and shall not have been altered or replaced in such a way that the noise caused by the escape of the exhaust gases is made greater by the alteration or replacement.

subsection.leadIn: Every motor vehicle shall be so constructed and maintained that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no excessive smoke or visible vapour is emitted therefrom;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so far as is reasonably practicable, the products of combustion, ashes, steam, cinders, petrol, water or oil are not discharged on the road or in such manner as to be likely to cause damage to property or injury or danger or loss of amenity or annoyance to persons.

subsection.content: For the purposes of paragraph (1)(a), smoke or visible vapour shall be deemed to be excessive if the smoke or visible vapour emitted from the vehicle measured by means of any one of the apparatuses specified by the Commissioner from time to time by notice published in the Gazette exceeds the maximum permitted smoke or visible vapour level specified in column 1 of Part I of the Fourth Schedule or the maximum permitted smoke or visible vapour level in absolute units of light absorption specified in column 2 of that Part. (L.N. 14 of 1999; L.N. 160 of 2000)

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: For the avoidance of doubt, a notice under paragraph (2) is not subsidiary legislation. (L.N. 14 of 1999)
Every motor vehicle using solid fuel shall be fitted with an efficient appliance for the purpose of preventing the emission of sparks or grit.

It shall be a good defence in any proceedings in respect of a contravention of this regulation to prove that the emission or discharge was due to some temporary or accidental cause which could not be prevented by the exercise of reasonable care.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting regulation 31, this regulation applies to every motor vehicle (other than a motor cycle or a motor tricycle) that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: manufactured on or after 1 January 1975 and is equipped with a positive-ignition engine and uses unleaded petrol as fuel; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: equipped with a positive-ignition engine and uses liquefied petroleum gas as fuel.

subsection.content: A motor vehicle to which this regulation applies shall be so constructed and maintained that its exhaust emission is not excessive.

For the purposes of paragraph (2), exhaust emission is excessive, in the case of a motor vehicle that is equipped with a positive-ignition engine and uses unleaded petrol as fuel, if the exhaust emission, measured in accordance with the procedure specified in column 2 of Part II of the Fourth Schedule and which is applicable to that motor vehicle having regard to its date of manufacture, does not comply with the standard applicable to that motor vehicle specified in column 3 of that Part.

For the purposes of paragraph (2), exhaust emission is excessive, in the case of a motor vehicle that is equipped with a positive-ignition engine and uses liquefied petroleum gas as fuel, if the exhaust emission, measured in accordance with the procedure specified in column 1 of Part III of the Fourth Schedule, does not comply with the standard specified in column 2 of that Part.

For the purposes of paragraphs (3) and (4), exhaust emission shall be measured by means of any one of the apparatuses specified by the Commissioner from time to time by notice published in the Gazette.
For the avoidance of doubt, a notice under paragraph (5) is not subsidiary legislation.

It shall be a defence in any proceedings in respect of a contravention of this regulation to prove that the excessive exhaust emission was due to some temporary or accidental cause which could not be prevented by the exercise of reasonable care.

Every motor vehicle, other than a bus, light bus, goods vehicle or special purpose vehicle, shall be equipped with mudguards or other similar fittings extending to cover the full width of each wheel and tyre and extending sufficiently around the circumference of each wheel and tyre to catch, so far as reasonably practicable, mud or water thrown up by the rotation of the wheels, unless adequate protection is afforded by the body of the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (3), every bus, light bus, goods vehicle or special purpose vehicle shall be equipped with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: mudguards at all wheels; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: mudflaps behind the rearmost wheels,

subsection.continued: which shall be of specifications approved by the Commissioner as being reasonably necessary to ensure that, so far as is reasonably practicable, mud or water thrown up by the rotation of the wheels is caught.

subsection.content: Paragraph (2) shall not apply if the body of the bus, light bus, goods vehicle or special purpose vehicle affords adequate protection to catch, so far as is reasonably practicable, mud or water thrown up by the rotation of the wheels.
The Commissioner shall by notice in the Gazette publish the specifications of mudguards and mudflaps approved by him for the purpose of paragraph (2).

subsection.def: In this regulation, mudflap (擋泥翼) means a device that acts as a lower extension to a mudguard.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Mascots and other attachments
section.content: No mascot or other unnecessary attachment shall be carried by a motor vehicle in any position where it is likely to strike any person with whom the vehicle may collide unless the mascot or attachment is not liable to cause injury to such person by reason of any projection thereon.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (4), a person must not install or cause to be installed in or on a motor vehicle and a motor vehicle must not have installed in or on it a visual display unit other than a visual display unit that complies with the requirements specified in paragraph (2)— (L.N. 1 of 2000; L.N. 178 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at any point forward of the driver’s seat;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so that the screen of the visual display unit is partly or wholly, and whether directly or in any reflection, visible to the driver whilst in the driving seat; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: so that the controls of the visual display unit, other than the sound volume control and the main switch, are within reach of the driver whilst in the driving seat.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of paragraph (1), the requirements are that the visual display unit is designed in such a way that, when the parking brake of the vehicle is not applied, the visual display unit only displays any or all of the following information— (L.N. 178 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information about the current state of the vehicle or its equipment;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the current closed-circuit view of any part of the vehicle or the area surrounding the vehicle;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: information about the current location of the vehicle;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other information which is only for the purpose of navigating the vehicle. (L.N. 1 of 2000)

subsection.content: A person must not make any alteration to such a visual display unit installed in or on a motor vehicle so as to enable it to display information other than any of the information mentioned in paragraph (2) when the parking brake of the vehicle is not applied. (L.N. 178 of 2024)
This regulation does not apply in relation to a visual display unit that is installed in such a way that it can be readily removed from the motor vehicle. (L.N. 178 of 2024)
Every motor vehicle shall be fitted with an instrument capable of giving audible and sufficient warning of its approach or presence.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Every goods vehicle shall also be fitted with an automatic device capable of giving audible and sufficient warning when it is reversing and is about to reverse. (L.N. 1 of 2000)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: An instrument fitted for the purposes of paragraph (1) must be capable of emitting a continuous and uniform sound and must not emit any other sound. (L.N. 1 of 2000)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: An automatic device described in paragraph (1A)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is fitted in a goods vehicle for the purposes of that paragraph; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if fitted in any other motor vehicle,

subsection.continued: must be capable of emitting an intermittent and uniform sound and must not emit any other sound. (L.N. 1 of 2000)

subsection.leadIn: Notwithstanding paragraphs (1), (1A), (1B) and (1C), no motor vehicle shall be fitted with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a gong or bell;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a siren;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a multi-toned horn giving a succession of different notes;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a two-tone horn;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a sound producing device giving an unduly harsh, shrill, loud or alarming noise; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a sound producing device giving a sound which is likely to be confused with a sound emitted from a light signal prescribed by regulation 33 of the Road Traffic (Traffic Control) Regulations (Cap. 374 sub. leg. G) at a light signal crossing within the meaning of those Regulations in the operation of that light signal, (L.N. 1 of 2000) [cf. S.I. 1986/1078 r. 99(3)(b) U.K.]

subsection.continued: unless authorized by the Commissioner by permit in writing and any such permit shall be subject to such conditions as he may specify. (L.N. 1 of 2000)

subsection.leadIn: This regulation applies to a specified vehicle that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is capable of being solely propelled by an electric motor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is manufactured on or after 1 January 2026.

subsection.leadIn: The vehicle must be equipped with an acoustic vehicle alerting system—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that conforms with the performance requirements of any specification or standard set out in Schedule 20; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the operation of which cannot be manually suspended or stopped.

subsection.content: The acoustic vehicle alerting system must be maintained in good and efficient working order.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence in any proceedings for a contravention of paragraph (3) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the defect occurred in the course of the journey during which the contravention was detected; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time when the contravention was detected, steps had already been taken to have the defect remedied with all reasonable expedition.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—

def.name: AcousticVehicleAlertingSystem
def.leadIn: acoustic vehicle alerting system (車輛聲響警報系統) means a system, device or equipment that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is designed to be fitted in a motor vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: emits sounds in order to alert other road users of the approach or presence of the vehicle;

def.name: SpecifiedVehicle
def.leadIn: specified vehicle (指明車輛) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a private car;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a taxi;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a light bus;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a bus;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a goods vehicle; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a special purpose vehicle that is adapted from any motor vehicle mentioned in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e).

section.name: s39
section.heading: Mirrors for observing traffic to rear and on both sides rearwards—for vehicles other than those referred to in regulations 39AA, 39AAC and 39AAD

subsection.leadIn: This regulation applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following motor vehicles that is manufactured before 1 January 2028—

subparagraph.content: a private car;
a taxi;
a light bus;
a van-type light goods vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following motor vehicles that is first registered before 1 January 2028—

subparagraph.content: a bus;
a light goods vehicle (other than a van-type light goods vehicle);
a medium goods vehicle;
a heavy goods vehicle;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a special purpose vehicle that is adapted from—

subparagraph.content: any motor vehicle mentioned in subparagraph (a) or (b);
a motor cycle or motor tricycle manufactured before 1 January 2028; or
an invalid carriage; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a special purpose vehicle other than one mentioned in—

subparagraph.content: subparagraph (c);
regulation 39AAC(1)(a)(vii) or (b)(v); or
regulation 39AAD(1)(c).

subsection.leadIn: The vehicle must be equipped with at least two mirrors that are fitted in the following manner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one of the mirrors must be fitted externally on the off side of the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the other mirror must be fitted either internally to the vehicle or externally on the near side of the vehicle.

subsection.content: The mirrors must be so constructed and fitted to the vehicle as to assist the driver to become aware of traffic to the rear and on both sides rearwards.

section.name: s39AA
section.heading: Mirrors for observing traffic to rear—for motor cycles and motor tricycles manufactured before 1 January 2028 and invalid carriages

subsection.leadIn: This regulation applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a motor cycle or motor tricycle that is manufactured before 1 January 2028; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an invalid carriage.

subsection.leadIn: The vehicle must be equipped with a mirror that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is fitted externally on the off side of the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is so constructed and fitted to the vehicle as to assist the driver to become aware of traffic to the rear.

section.name: s39AAB
section.heading: Mirrors for observing alighting passengers—for light buses manufactured and buses first registered before 1 January 2028

subsection.leadIn: This regulation applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a light bus that is manufactured before 1 January 2028; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a bus that is first registered before 1 January 2028.

subsection.leadIn: The vehicle must be equipped with at least one mirror that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is fitted externally on the near side front of the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is of such size and so constructed and fitted to the vehicle as to give the driver a full and clear view of any passenger who is alighting from the vehicle.

subsection.content: The mirror fitted to a motor vehicle under paragraph (2) may be the same mirror fitted to the vehicle externally on its near side under regulation 39(2)(b).

section.name: s39AAC
section.heading: Mirrors and camera-monitor systems for observing traffic—for certain vehicles manufactured or first registered on or after 1 January 2028

subsection.leadIn: This regulation applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following motor vehicles that is manufactured on or after 1 January 2028—

subparagraph.content: a private car;
a taxi;
a light bus;
a van-type light goods vehicle;
a motor cycle the bodywork of which partly or wholly encloses the driver;
a motor tricycle the bodywork of which partly or wholly encloses the driver;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following motor vehicles that is first registered on or after 1 January 2028—

subparagraph.content: a bus;
a light goods vehicle (other than a van-type light goods vehicle);
a medium goods vehicle;
a heavy goods vehicle;
a special purpose vehicle that is adapted from any motor vehicle mentioned in sub-subparagraph (i), (ii), (iii) or (iv).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (3), the vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must comply with the following requirements—

subparagraph.content: it must be equipped with such number of mirrors as is specified in any scheduled standard; and
the mirror or mirrors must conform with the performance and installation requirements of that scheduled standard;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: must be equipped with a combination of the following appliances that conforms with the installation requirements of any scheduled standard—

subparagraph.content: a mirror that conforms with the performance requirements of that scheduled standard; and
a camera-monitor system that conforms with the performance requirements of that scheduled standard.

subsection.content: For a medium goods vehicle mentioned in paragraph (1)(b)(iii), even if a requirement on the provision of front view by a mirror or camera-monitor system as set out in any scheduled standards is optional in relation to the vehicle, the vehicle must still be equipped with the mirror or system that conforms with the requirement as if the requirement were compulsory in relation to the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: scheduled standard (附表標準) means a specification or standard set out in Part 1 of Schedule 21.

subsection.content: In this regulation, a reference to the installation requirements of a scheduled standard includes a requirement on the field of vision to be provided as set out in that standard.

section.name: s39AAD
section.heading: Mirrors for observing traffic—for motor cycles and motor tricycles manufactured on or after 1 January 2028 and special purpose vehicles adapted from them

subsection.leadIn: This regulation applies to any of the following motor vehicles that is manufactured on or after 1 January 2028—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a motor cycle—

subparagraph.content: the bodywork of which does not enclose the driver; or
that does not have bodywork;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a motor tricycle—

subparagraph.content: the bodywork of which does not enclose the driver; or
that does not have bodywork;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a special purpose vehicle that is adapted from any motor vehicle mentioned in subparagraph (a) or (b).

subsection.content: The vehicle must be equipped with such number of mirrors as is specified in any specification or standard set out in Part 2 of Schedule 21, and the mirror or mirrors must conform with the performance and installation requirements of that specification or standard.
Even if a mirror is not required to be fitted externally on the off side of the vehicle under paragraph (2), at least one mirror must be so fitted to the vehicle.

section.name: s39AAE
section.heading: Mirrors and camera-monitor systems for observing alighting passengers—for light buses manufactured and buses first registered on or after 1 January 2028

subsection.leadIn: This regulation applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a light bus that is manufactured on or after 1 January 2028; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a bus that is first registered on or after 1 January 2028.

subsection.leadIn: The vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must be equipped with at least one mirror that—

subparagraph.content: is fitted externally on the near side front of the vehicle; and
is of such size and so constructed and fitted to the vehicle as to give the driver a full and clear view of any passenger who is alighting from the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be equipped with a camera-monitor system that—

subparagraph.content: gives the driver a full and clear view of any passenger who is alighting from the vehicle; and
conforms with the performance requirements of any specification or standard set out in Part 1 of Schedule 21.

subsection.content: The mirror or camera-monitor system fitted to a motor vehicle under paragraph (2) may be the same mirror or camera-monitor system fitted to the vehicle under regulation 39AAC(2).

section.name: s39AAF
section.heading: Miscellaneous requirements in relation to mirrors

subsection.content: The edges of a mirror fitted internally to a motor vehicle must be surrounded by some material such that, if the mirror or that material is struck by any person in or on the vehicle, severe cuts are unlikely to be inflicted on the person.

subsection.leadIn: The mirror that is fitted externally to a motor vehicle must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be fitted to the vehicle in such a way that it remains steady under normal driving conditions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the vehicle is fitted with windows and a windscreen—be fitted in such a way as to be visible to the driver (when in the driving seat) through—

subparagraph.content: a side window; or
the portion of the windscreen that is swept by the windscreen wipers.

subsection.leadIn: Unless a mirror referred to in paragraph (2) is so designed as not to cause injury to any person in the event of a collision, the mirror must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the bottom of the mirror is less than 2 metres above the road surface when the vehicle is laden—project more than 10 centimetres beyond the overall width of the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the vehicle is towing a trailer with an overall width greater than that of the towing vehicle—project more than 20 centimetres beyond the overall width of the trailer.

section.name: s39AAG
section.heading: Miscellaneous requirements in relation to camera-monitor systems

subsection.content: The edges of a monitor unit of a camera-monitor system that is fitted internally to a motor vehicle must be surrounded by some material such that, if the monitor unit or that material is struck by any person in or on the vehicle, severe cuts are unlikely to be inflicted on the person.
A camera unit of a camera-monitor system fitted externally on a motor vehicle must be fitted to the vehicle in such a way that it remains steady under normal driving conditions.

subsection.leadIn: Unless a camera unit referred to in paragraph (2) is so designed as not to cause injury to any person in the event of a collision, the camera unit must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the bottom of the camera unit is less than 2 metres above the road surface when the vehicle is laden—project more than 10 centimetres beyond the overall width of the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the vehicle is towing a trailer with an overall width greater than that of the towing vehicle—project more than 20 centimetres beyond the overall width of the trailer.

subsection.leadIn: This regulation applies to a goods vehicle that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is first registered on or after 1 October 2014; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: is neither—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a tractor unit designed primarily to form part of an articulated vehicle; nor

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a trailer.

subsection.content: The vehicle must be fitted with a reversing video device.
The device must be maintained in good working order.

subsection.leadIn: The device must be so fitted to the vehicle that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it automatically displays a current closed-circuit view of the area specified in paragraph (5) when the vehicle is reversing or about to reverse; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the view is clear to the driver in the driving position, whether in the daytime or at night, except when the visibility is reduced by weather conditions.

subsection.leadIn: The specified area is the area behind the extreme rear of the vehicle that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: extends in length to at least 3 200 mm from the extreme rear of the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: extends in width to at least 500 mm from the outermost part on each side of the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence in any proceedings for a contravention of paragraph (3) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the defect occurred in the course of the journey during which the contravention was detected; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time when the contravention was detected, steps had already been taken to have the defect remedied with all reasonable expedition.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Construction of fuel tank
section.leadIn: Every motor vehicle shall be so constructed that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any fuel tank fixed on the vehicle is in such a position that it is reasonably secure against its being damaged; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the leakage of any liquid or vapour from such fuel tank is adequately prevented:
paragraph.proviso: Provided however that nothing in this subparagraph shall preclude any fuel tank being fitted with a device which by the intake of air or the emission of vapour relieves changes in pressure in the tank.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (2), this regulation shall apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a goods vehicle which has a permitted gross vehicle weight exceeding 5.5 tonnes and the distance between the centres of any 2 consecutive axles exceeds 3 metres;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a trailer which has a permitted gross vehicle weight exceeding 2 tonnes and the distance between the centres of any 2 consecutive axles exceeds 3 metres; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a semi-trailer which has a permitted gross vehicle weight exceeding 2 tonnes and the distance between the centre of its first axle and the centre of the king-pin (the rearmost king-pin, if more than one) exceeds 4.5 metres.

subsection.leadIn: This regulation does not apply to— (L.N. 178 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a tractor unit of an articulated vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a vehicle which is incapable by reason of its construction of exceeding a speed of 25 kilometres per hour under its own power on the road;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an agricultural trailer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a vehicle so constructed that it can unload by tipping sideways or rearwards;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a vehicle, without bodywork, which is being driven or towed by its manufacturer, dealer or distributor for a quality check or to premises of the manufacturer, dealer or distributor; (L.N. 178 of 2024)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a vehicle being driven or towed to a place where, by previous arrangement, the bodywork or sideguards are to be fitted; (L.N. 178 of 2024)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a trailer specially designed and constructed to carry round timber, beams or girders of exceptional length;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a trailer specially designed and constructed to carry other vehicles loaded onto it from the front or the rear; and

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a trailer with a load platform where no part of the edge of the platform which is more than 60 millimetres inboard from the tangential plane and the upper surface of the platform is not more than 750 millimetres from the ground in the area where a sideguard would but for this provision have to be fitted.

subsection.leadIn: Every vehicle to which this regulation applies shall be fitted with sideguards constructed and fitted to meet the following requirements —

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the outermost surface of the sideguard shall be smooth, essentially rigid and either flat or horizontally corrugated;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.leadIn: where the floor of the vehicle to which the sideguard is fitted—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: extends laterally outside the tangential plane;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is not more than 1.85 metres from the ground;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: extends laterally over the whole of the length of the sideguard; and

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: is wholly covered at its edge by a side-rave the lower edge of which is not more than 150 millimetres below the underside of the floor,

paragraph.continued: the highest edge shall not be more than 350 millimetres below the lower edge of the side-rave;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: where the floor of the vehicle to which the sideguard is fitted—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: extends laterally outside the tangential plane; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not comply with all of the provisions specified in subparagraph (d)(ii), (iii) and (iv), and any part of the structure of the vehicle is cut within 1.85 metres of the ground by the tangential plane,

paragraph.continued: the highest edge shall not be more than 350 millimetres below the structure of the vehicle where it is cut by the tangential plane;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: no part of the structure of the vehicle is cut within 1.85 metres of the ground by the tangential plane; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the upper surface of the load carrying structure of the vehicle is less than 1.5 metres from the ground,

paragraph.continued: the highest edge shall not be less than the height of the upper surface of the load carrying structure of the vehicle;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in any case other than subparagraph (d), (e) or (f), the highest edge shall not be less than 1.5 metres from the ground;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the distance between the rearmost edge of the sideguard and the tyre nearest to it shall not exceed 300 millimetres;

paragraph.name: i
j
paragraph.content: in the case of a semi-trailer with landing legs, the distance shall be as in subparagraph (i) unless the centre of the landing leg is less than 2.75 metres from the king-pin, then the front edge of the sideguard shall not be over 250 millimetres from the centre of the leg;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: in the case of a vehicle other than a semi-trailer, the front edge of the sideguard shall not be more than 300 millimetres from the nearest front tyre in the case of a motor vehicle, or 500 millimetres in the case of a trailer;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: all external edges of a sideguard shall be rounded at a radius of at least 2.5 millimetres;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: no sideguard shall be more than 30 millimetres inboard from the tangential plane;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: a sideguard shall not add to the vehicle’s width;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: a sideguard shall extend downwards at least 100 millimetres from its highest edge, 100 millimetres upwards from its lowest edge and 100 millimetres rearwards and inwards from its front edge and shall not have a vertical gap more than 300 millimetres nor a vertical surface less than 100 millimetres; and

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: subparagraphs (h) to (k) shall not apply to any additional length attributed to the extending of an extendable trailer beyond its minimum length or to any vehicle constructed to carry a demountable body or lift-off container.

subsection.content: The requirements in paragraph (3) shall apply only as far as is practicable in the case of a vehicle fitted with a tank for carrying fluid which is provided with valves and hose or pipe connections for loading and unloading and in the case of a vehicle with extending stabilisers required for stability during loading, unloading or while used for operations for which it is designed or adapted.

Every sideguard fitted to a vehicle in pursuance of this regulation shall at all times while the vehicle is used on a road be maintained free from any defect which might in any way affect its effectiveness.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (2), this regulation applies to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a trailer which has a permitted gross vehicle weight exceeding 2 tonnes; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a semi-trailer which has a permitted gross vehicle weight exceeding 2 tonnes.

subsection.leadIn: This regulation does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a tractor unit of an articulated vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a vehicle which is incapable by reason of its construction of exceeding a speed of 25 kilometres per hour under its own power on the road;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an agricultural trailer;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a vehicle fitted at the rear with apparatus specially designed for spreading material on a road;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a vehicle without bodywork which is being driven or towed by its manufacturer, dealer or distributor for a quality check or to premises of the manufacturer, dealer or distributor; (L.N. 178 of 2024)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a chassis-cab;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a vehicle specially designed and constructed as a vehicle transporter;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a trailer specially designed and constructed for carrying round timber, beams or girders of exceptional length;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a vehicle being driven or towed to a place where, by previous arrangement, the bodywork or rearguard is to be fitted; (L.N. 178 of 2024)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a concrete mixer;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: a vehicle fitted with a tail lift so constructed that the lift platform forms part of the floor of the vehicle and this part has a length of at least 1 metre measured parallel to the longitudinal axis of the vehicle or fitted with such tail lift installation which will render rearguard installation impractical;

paragraph.name: l
m
paragraph.content: a vehicle so constructed that it can be unloaded by part of the vehicle being tipped rearwards.

subsection.leadIn: Every vehicle to which this regulation applies shall be fitted with rearguards constructed and fitted to meet the following requirements—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the lower edge of the rearguard shall not be more than 550 millimetres above the ground;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the outer edge of the rearguard shall not be extended beyond the outer faces of the rear axle measured at the outermost points of the wheels, excluding the bulging of the tyres close to the ground, or more than 100 millimetres inboard from either outer face of the rear axle, and more than 300 millimetres inboard from either outer face of the rear axle in the case of a vehicle fitted with a demountable body; and in a case where there is more than one rear axle, the width to be considered is that of the widest rear axle; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the rearguard shall consist of a cross-member and linking components connected to the chassis side members or to whatever replaces the chassis side members; the section height of the cross-member shall not be less than 100 millimetres.

subsection.content: Every rearguard fitted to a vehicle in pursuance of this regulation shall at all times when the vehicle is used on a road be maintained free from any defect which might in any way affect adversely its function of giving resistance in the event of an impact from the rear.
A motor vehicle must not be equipped with a remote control parking system unless the system is an approved remote control parking system under paragraph (2).

subsection.leadIn: A remote control parking system of a motor vehicle (subject vehicle) is an approved remote control parking system if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the system is of a design and construction approved by the Commissioner in respect of the model of the subject vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a remote control parking device that can control the subject vehicle through the system enables the subject vehicle to move only if—

subparagraph.content: the application of the device that is designed for remotely parking the subject vehicle is continuously activated;
the signal between the subject vehicle and the device is maintained; and
the distance between the subject vehicle and the device does not exceed 6 metres; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the system is capable of—

subparagraph.content: detecting road users, other vehicles and any other obstacles in the area surrounding the subject vehicle when the subject vehicle is being remotely parked; and
bringing the subject vehicle to a stop immediately.

subsection.content: For the purposes of paragraph (2)(a), the Commissioner is to signify the approval in writing.
The remote control parking system of a motor vehicle must be maintained in good and efficient working order.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—

def.name: RemoteControlParkingSystem
def.leadIn: remote control parking system (遙控泊車系統), in relation to a motor vehicle, means a system that is used or designed to be used to remotely park the vehicle by controlling all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the braking system of the vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the steering mechanism of the vehicle;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an accelerator device of the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation, a reference to remotely parking a motor vehicle—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a reference to parking the vehicle by the use of a remote control parking device; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes moving the vehicle out of the place where it is parked by the use of a remote control parking device.

section.name: s40D
section.heading: Over-height warning systems for vehicles with extendable aerial structures—requirements

subsection.content: Subject to regulations 40E and 40F, this regulation applies to a vehicle fitted with an extendable aerial structure that, when raised or extended upwards, may cause the extended overall height of the vehicle to exceed its specified overall height.

The vehicle must be equipped with a warning system that is capable of giving audible and visible warnings to the driver when in the driving seat during the time the extended overall height of the vehicle exceeds its specified overall height while the vehicle is in motion.
The warning system must be so constructed that its operation cannot be manually suspended or stopped while the vehicle is in motion.

subsection.leadIn: The warning system must comply with both of the following requirements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every part of the system must be properly and securely fitted to the vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the system must be maintained in good and efficient working order.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence in any proceedings for a contravention of paragraph (4)(b) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the defect occurred in the course of the journey during which the contravention was detected; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the time when the contravention was detected, steps had already been taken to have the defect remedied with all reasonable expedition.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—

def.name: ExtendedOverallHeight
def.leadIn: extended overall height (延伸後全高度), in relation to a vehicle fitted with an extendable aerial structure, means, while the vehicle is standing on a level surface with all tyres inflated to normal pressure and with the structure raised or extended upwards, the height of the vehicle measured vertically from the surface to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the highest point of the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the highest point of the structure,

subsection.def: specified overall height (指明全高度), in relation to a vehicle, means the overall height specified in relation to the vehicle in column 4 of the First Schedule.

section.name: s40E
section.heading: Over-height warning systems for vehicles with extendable aerial structures—exemption and transitional provisions for certain lorry cranes

subsection.leadIn: Regulation 40D does not apply to a lorry crane (other than a lorry crane specified in paragraph (2)) that is first registered before 1 March 2025 until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the lorry crane is next required under section 78(1) of the Ordinance to be produced for examination before it is licensed (but excluding a date that falls before 1 September 2025); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the vehicle licence in respect of the lorry crane ceases to be valid,

subsection.continued: whichever is the earlier.

subsection.content: A specified lorry crane that is first registered on or before 31 December 2012 is exempt from regulation 40D so long as the condition specified in paragraph (3) is met in relation to the lorry crane.

For the purposes of paragraph (2), the condition is that if the lorry crane were first registered on 1 March 2025, its emission could not conform to the vehicle design standards that would be applicable to the lorry crane under the Air Pollution Control (Vehicle Design Standards) (Emission) Regulations (Cap. 311 sub. leg. J).

subsection.leadIn: If a lorry crane specified in paragraph (2) ceases to be exempt from regulation 40D on a date (cessation date), that regulation does not apply to the lorry crane until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the lorry crane is next required under section 78(1) of the Ordinance to be produced for examination before it is licensed (but excluding a date that falls before the cessation date); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the vehicle licence in respect of the lorry crane ceases to be valid,

subsection.continued: whichever is the earlier.

subsection.leadIn: In paragraph (2)—
subsection.def: specified lorry crane (指明機動式起重吊車) means a lorry crane that is a controlled vehicle within the meaning of section 3(1)(da) of the Air Pollution Control (Air Pollutant Emission) (Controlled Vehicles) Regulation (Cap. 311 sub. leg. X).

section.name: s40F
section.heading: Over-height warning systems for vehicles with extendable aerial structures—exemption and transitional provisions for certain vehicles other than lorry cranes

subsection.leadIn: Regulation 40D does not apply to a motor vehicle (other than a motor vehicle specified in paragraph (2) or a lorry crane) that is first registered before 1 March 2025 until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the vehicle is next required under section 78(1) of the Ordinance to be produced for examination before it is licensed (but excluding a date that falls before 1 September 2026); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the vehicle licence in respect of the vehicle ceases to be valid,

subsection.continued: whichever is the earlier.

subsection.content: A specified vehicle that is first registered on or before 31 December 2013 is exempt from regulation 40D so long as the condition specified in paragraph (3) is met in relation to the vehicle.

For the purposes of paragraph (2), the condition is that if the vehicle were first registered on 1 March 2025, its emission could not conform to the vehicle design standards that would be applicable to the vehicle under the Air Pollution Control (Vehicle Design Standards) (Emission) Regulations (Cap. 311 sub. leg. J).

subsection.leadIn: If a motor vehicle specified in paragraph (2) ceases to be exempt from regulation 40D on a date (cessation date), that regulation does not apply to the vehicle until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the vehicle is next required under section 78(1) of the Ordinance to be produced for examination before it is licensed (but excluding a date that falls before the cessation date); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the vehicle licence in respect of the vehicle ceases to be valid,

subsection.continued: whichever is the earlier.

subsection.leadIn: In paragraph (2)—

def.name: SpecifiedVehicle
def.leadIn: specified vehicle (指明汽車) means a motor vehicle that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a controlled vehicle within the meaning of section 3(1)(da) of the Air Pollution Control (Air Pollutant Emission) (Controlled Vehicles) Regulation (Cap. 311 sub. leg. X); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not a lorry crane.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Taxis, Buses and Light Buses

subsection.content: Every taxi shall be fitted with a taximeter of a design and construction approved by the Commissioner.

subsection.leadIn: For the purpose of paragraph (1) the Commissioner may signify his approval either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: generally by notice in the Gazette; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any particular case in writing.

subsection.content: The Commissioner may specify the position and manner in which an approved taximeter may be fitted to a taxi, and where any such specification has been made every taximeter shall be fitted accordingly.
No taximeter or instrument similar to a taximeter shall be fitted to a vehicle without the prior approval of the Commissioner.
Every taximeter shall be provided with an indicator of a size not less than 100 millimetres by 50 millimetres displaying the words “FOR HIRE” or the word “TAXI”.

subsection.leadIn: Every taximeter shall be so constructed that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it may be sealed to the satisfaction of the Commissioner;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount of fare calculated by time or distance or a combination of time and distance as prescribed is indicated on the fare dial;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the amount of additional fares in progressive increments of the lowest fare as prescribed is indicated on the fare dial; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the height of the figures indicating the fare and additional fares is not less than 10 millimetres.

subsection.leadIn: The fare dial on every taximeter shall be such that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words “FARE” and “EXTRAS” appear above, below or beside the figures indicating such item; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the letters and words “H.K. dollars” and “cents” or the letters and symbols “H.K.$” and “c” appear immediately above, below or beside the figures indicating the fare and the extras; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the fare is indicated with a clear division between dollars and cents.

subsection.leadIn: Every taximeter shall be actuated by a device which shall cause the taximeter to be set to, and to operate in any one of, the following positions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: FOR HIRE, when the taximeter is not recording and the indicator display is clearly visible to any person standing in front of the taxi at a distance of 20 metres;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: HIRED, when the taximeter is recording by time or distance or a combination of time and distance and the indicator display is not visible outside the taxi;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: STOPPED, when—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the taximeter is recording by distance only and the indicator display is not visible outside the taxi; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the mechanism of the taxi is not in motion and the indicator display is not visible outside the taxi.

subsection.leadIn: The position of the taximeter actuating device whether—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: FOR HIRE;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: HIRED; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: STOPPED,

subsection.continued: shall be clearly shown on the fare dial.

subsection.content: The taximeter actuating device shall operate direct from the “FOR HIRE” position to the “HIRED” position and shall pass through the “STOPPED” position before being returned to the “FOR HIRE” position.
The fare dial of every taximeter shall be capable of being illuminated during the hours of darkness and when required by the hirer, so as to render the readings on the dial easily legible.

section.name: s42A
section.heading: Receipt printing device
section.content: There shall be installed a device, which is capable whilst in proper working order of printing a fare receipt within 12 seconds, in respect of every taxi, either by forming part of or being connected to the taximeter with which the taxi is fitted.

subsection.content: The gear box or transducer fitted in a taximeter drive shall be so designed that the output revolutions or the number of electronic pulses produced and the drive cable connexions are acceptable to approved types of taximeters.
All cable and taximeter gear box or transducer connexions shall be capable of being sealed to the satisfaction of the Commissioner.
A plate of an approved type and pattern shall be attached to every taximeter gear box or transducer.

subsection.leadIn: The plate attached in accordance with paragraph (3) shall be clearly and correctly marked with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the minimum effective circumference of the tyre on the wheels of the taxi to which the taximeter is connected;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of teeth on any driving pinion which drives the taximeter gear box;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reduction gear ratio of the final drive of the vehicle transmission; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the gear ratio of the taximeter gear box or the number of electronic pulses produced in one kilometre.

subsection.content: Every taximeter shall be tested by the Commissioner before it is fitted to a taxi and thereafter at intervals of not more than 6 months, and, if the tests prove satisfactory and the receipt printing device installed in respect of the taxi (whether by forming part of or being connected to the taximeter) is in proper working order, stamped and sealed by the Commissioner. (L.N. 148 of 1997)
The registered owner of a taxi shall submit the taxi, with the meter properly affixed, to the Commissioner in order that tests in accordance with paragraph (1) may be made.

The registered owner of a taxi shall report to the Commissioner, as soon as reasonably practicable, any fault or damage to the taximeter fitted to the taxi that may result in any inaccurate recording of the fare, or any damage to any stamp or seal of the Commissioner thereon.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Taxis to have illuminated signs and markings

subsection.leadIn: A general taxi must— (34 of 2023 s. 8)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: have fitted on the top of its roof an illuminated sign, of a type approved by the Commissioner, which at all times during the hours of darkness when the taxi is available for hire displays the word “TAXI” so that it is clearly visible from the front and the rear of the vehicle; and (L.N. 258 of 1984)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be plainly marked in English and Chinese writing of uniform size not less than 100 millimetres in height on the outside of the vehicle on both the near and off sides with the word “TAXI” and the characters “的士”.

subsection.leadIn: A fleet taxi must—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: be plainly marked in English and Chinese writing of uniform size not less than 100 millimetres in height on the outside of the vehicle on both the near and off sides with the word “TAXI” and the characters “的士”; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if any additional marking is required under the licence conditions—be marked with such marking. (34 of 2023 s. 8)

subsection.content: Every taxi shall display, on the front and on the back of the vehicle, a plate of the colour, form and dimensions set out in the diagram in Part I of the Sixth Schedule.
Every plate referred to in paragraph (1) shall comply with the provisions of Part II of the Sixth Schedule.

The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify the colour, combination of colours or colour scheme with which the outside of public buses, public light buses and general taxis must be painted. (34 of 2023 s. 9)

The Commissioner may, by notice published in the Gazette or by condition imposed by him on the issue of a motor vehicle licence in respect of each vehicle, specify the colour, combination of colours or colour scheme with which the outside of private buses and private light buses shall be painted.

The outside of every public bus, private bus, public light bus, private light bus and general taxi must be painted with such colour, combination of colours or colour scheme as the Commissioner may specify in respect of the vehicle under paragraph (1) or (2). (34 of 2023 s. 9)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: The outside of a fleet taxi must be painted in accordance with the conditions imposed on the taxi fleet licence under which the taxi is operated. (34 of 2023 s. 9)
This regulation shall not apply to buses operated under a franchise granted under the Public Bus Services Ordinance (Cap. 230).

section.name: s48
section.heading: Markings on buses
section.leadIn: Every bus shall be marked plainly and correctly in English and Chinese writing of uniform size, not less than 10 millimetres in height—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: inside the bus (on the lower deck if it is a double-decked bus); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: outside the bus at the rear or on the near side,

section.continued: with the number of passengers for whom seats are provided on each deck of the bus and the number of standing passengers who may be carried in a single-decked bus or on the lower deck of a double-decked bus while it is in motion (as specified in the registration document issued in respect of that vehicle).

section.name: s49
section.heading: Markings on public light buses and private light buses
section.content: Every public light bus and private light bus shall be plainly and correctly marked in English and Chinese writing of uniform size not less than 100 millimetres in height, on the outside of the vehicle on both the near and off sides, with the number of passengers for whom seats are provided.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Additional markings on public light buses
section.leadIn: Every public light bus shall be plainly marked—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in block letters and Chinese characters, of uniform size not less than 100 millimetres in height, on the outside of the vehicle on both the near and off sides, with the words “Public Light Bus” and the characters “公共小型巴士”. (E.R. 4 of 2022)

section.name: s51
section.heading: Signs on school private light buses

subsection.leadIn: A school private light bus providing a service for hire or reward—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: shall bear on the outside of the vehicle on the sides, front and back a continuous horizontal purple stripe of a uniform width of not less than 200 millimetres;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall bear on both the near and off sides, against the background of that purple stripe and in white colour, in block letters and Chinese characters of uniform size not less than 150 millimetres in height, the words “School Private Light Bus” and the characters “學校私家小巴”;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall bear on the back, against the background of that purple stripe, a sign of the colour, design and dimensions set out in the diagram in the Thirteenth Schedule;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may bear the name or names in English and Chinese writing, on the outside of the vehicle on both the near and off sides, of the educational institution or institutions to or from which the passengers of the school private light bus are being carried; and (L.N. 96 of 1997)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: subject to subparagraphs (a) to (d), shall be painted in yellow on the outside of the vehicle. (L.N. 96 of 1997)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: paragraph (1)(a), (b) and (c), the colour purple shall be of British Standard Colour 24E56 @BS 5252: 1976 or Australian Standard Colour AS2700-1985:P13; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: paragraph (1)(e), the colour yellow shall be of British Standard Colour 08E53 @BS 5252: 1976 or Australian Standard Colour AS2700-1985:Y15. (L.N. 96 of 1997)

subsection.content: A school private light bus registered before 1 May 1997 shall be deemed to comply with this regulation if it complies with this regulation as in force immediately before that date. (L.N. 306 of 1998)

section.name: s52
section.heading: Maintenance of markings and painting of certain vehicles
section.leadIn: The owner of every bus, public light bus, private light bus or general taxi, or the fleet licensee in respect of a fleet taxi, must ensure that— (34 of 2023 s. 10)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the markings required by these regulations to be on the vehicle are kept legible at all times; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the vehicle is kept painted at all times in accordance with these regulations.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Prohibition marking and painting of vehicles other than buses and taxis

subsection.leadIn: A motor vehicle must not be— (34 of 2023 s. 11)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: marked with any marking required by these regulations to be on a public light bus, private light bus or general taxi; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so marked as to closely resemble a public light bus, private light bus or general taxi,

subsection.continued: unless the vehicle is a public light bus, private light bus or taxi as the case may be. (34 of 2023 s. 11)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (1B), a motor vehicle must not be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: marked with any marking required by these regulations to be on a fleet taxi operated under the relevant licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so marked as to closely resemble such a fleet taxi. (34 of 2023 s. 11)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Paragraph (1A) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the motor vehicle is a fleet taxi operated under the relevant licence; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the marking marked on the motor vehicle is a marking required by these regulations to be on the motor vehicle. (34 of 2023 s. 11)

subsection.leadIn: No motor vehicle shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: painted with such colour, combination of colours or colour scheme as the Commissioner may specify under regulation 47(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so painted as to closely resemble such colour, combination of colours or colour scheme,

subsection.continued: unless the vehicle is a public bus, public light bus or taxi.

subsection.leadIn: In this regulation—
subsection.def: relevant licence (有關牌照), in relation to a fleet taxi, means the taxi fleet licence under which the taxi is operated. (34 of 2023 s. 11)

section.name: s54
section.heading: Markings on buses, light buses and taxis

subsection.leadIn: A bus, public light bus, private light bus or taxi must not bear any marking, colour marking, sign, word, figure or character other than such as— (34 of 2023 s. 12)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is required or permitted, under any Ordinance or under any condition subject to which a motor vehicle licence or a taxi fleet licence has been issued in respect of the vehicle, to be borne on the vehicle; or (34 of 2023 s. 12)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Commissioner may in writing permit.

subsection.leadIn: No bus, public light bus, private light bus or taxi shall have marked on it a number purporting to be the seating or standing capacity of the vehicle, unless the number accords with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of passengers for whom seats are provided in the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the number of standing passengers who may be carried in a single-decked bus or on the lower deck of a double-decked bus while it is in motion,

subsection.continued: entered in the registration document in respect of that vehicle.

subsection.content: The stability of a double-decked bus shall be such that when loaded with weights placed in the correct relative positions to represent the driver and a full complement of passengers on the upper deck only, if the surface on which the vehicle stands were tilted to either side to an angle of 28 degrees from the horizontal, the point at which overturning occurs would not be passed.

The stability of a single-decked bus and light bus shall be such that when loaded with weights placed in the correct relative positions to represent the driver and a full complement of passengers, if the surface on which the vehicle stands were tilted to either side to an angle of 35 degrees from the horizontal, the point at which overturning occurs would not be passed.

For the purpose of conducting tests of stability the height of any stop used to prevent a wheel of the bus or light bus from slipping sideways shall not be greater than two thirds of the distance between the surface upon which the vehicle stands before it is tilted and that part of the rim of that wheel which is the nearest to such surface when the vehicle is loaded in accordance with the requirements of this regulation.
For the purposes of this regulation, 57 kilograms shall be deemed to represent the weight of one person.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Side overhang
section.leadIn: No part of a bus or light bus, other than a direction indicator, a driving mirror, or a camera unit of a camera-monitor system, may project laterally beyond the outer face of the outer tyre of the rearmost wheel on the same side of the vehicle as the projection in the case of— (L.N. 178 of 2024)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a bus, by more than 150 millimetres; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a light bus, by more than 180 millimetres.

subsection.content: If any two wheels on the same side of a bus have a clear space of more than 600 millimetres between their nearest points, a guard rail, running board or other similar device, which shall extend to within 220 millimetres of the front wheel and 150 millimetres of the rear wheel, shall be fixed to guard such space effectively to within at least 250 millimetres of the ground when the vehicle is carrying no passengers and is standing on level ground.

Any guard rail fitted in compliance with this regulation shall be so constructed and fitted that, when necessary, by raising the rail or otherwise, access can easily be obtained to any part of the space underneath the vehicle.
Where brake and steering connexions of a bus are secured with bolts or pins, the bolts or pins shall be threaded and effectively locked.
The steering arm, steering rods and joints and all other moving parts of the steering mechanism of a bus shall be kept clean and free from rust.

content.leadIn: The ball and socket joints of steering connexions when such are used in the steering mechanism of a bus shall not be pendant:
content.proviso: Provided that this paragraph shall not apply to spring loaded self-adjusting spherical joints.

subsection.content: Dust-excluding covers fitted to any joint or connexion of the steering mechanism of a bus shall be capable of being easily removed to facilitate inspection.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Hub projection
section.content: No portion of any wheel of a bus or any of its fittings shall project more than 90 millimetres beyond the extreme outer face of the tyre when fully inflated.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Fuel tanks, carburettors, etc. on buses and light buses

subsection.content: No fuel tank shall, in any single-decked bus, half-decked bus or lower deck of a double-decked bus, be placed under any part of any gangway or under any part of any passage leading to an emergency exit (not being a secondary emergency exit) if that part of the gangway or passage is within 600 millimetres of any entrance or exit.

No fuel tank shall, in any light bus, be placed immediately under any entrance or exit or within 300 millimetres of any entrance or exit and no filling point for a fuel tank shall be situated at the rear of the vehicle.
No part of any fuel tank or apparatus for the supply of fuel shall, in any bus or light bus, be placed in the compartments or other spaces provided for the accommodation of the driver or passengers.

All fuel tanks and all apparatus supplying fuel to the engine shall, in every bus and light bus, be so placed or shielded that no fuel overflowing or leaking therefrom can fall or accumulate upon any woodwork forming part of the vehicle or upon any other part of the vehicle or fitting thereto such that it might readily be ignited or can fall into any receptacle where it might accumulate.

The filling points for all fuel tanks shall, in every bus and light bus, be accessible only from the outside of the vehicle and filler caps shall be so designed and constructed that they cannot be dislodged by accidental operation and any vent hole shall be protected from danger of penetration by fire and shall be so designed as to prevent fuel from being splashed over.

subsection.leadIn: A device shall be provided in every bus and light bus by means of which the supply of fuel to any carburettor or, in the case of a fuel injection pump, to the injection nozzles, can be readily cut off and the following requirements shall be complied with in respect thereof—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the means of operation shall at all times be readily accessible from outside the vehicle and, except in the case of a vehicle fitted with an engine having a fuel injection system, shall be readily visible from the outside of the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in a case where the device is so visible, the “off” position of the means of operation thereof shall be clearly marked also on the outside of the vehicle, and in a case where the said device is not so visible, its position shall be clearly marked on the outside of the vehicle and the means of operation shall also be clearly indicated. (E.R. 4 of 2022)

section.name: s61
section.heading: Exhaust pipes on buses and light buses

subsection.leadIn: The exhaust pipe of every bus and light bus shall be so fitted or shielded, and maintained that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no inflammable material can be thrown upon it from any other part of the vehicle;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is not likely to cause a fire through proximity to any inflammable material on the vehicle; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: so far as is reasonably practicable, fumes are prevented from entering the vehicle from it.

subsection.leadIn: The outlet of the exhaust pipe of every bus and light bus shall be placed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the off side of the vehicle; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at the rear of the vehicle, as near as is reasonably practicable to the off side of the vehicle.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Locking of nuts
section.content: All moving parts of a bus and light bus and all parts subject to severe vibration which are connected by bolts or studs and nuts shall be fastened by lock nuts or by nuts and efficient spring or locking washers or by castellated nuts and split pins or by some other efficient device to prevent their working or coming loose.

subsection.leadIn: In every bus—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: adequate internal lighting shall be provided for the illumination of— (L.N. 95 of 1993)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: each deck thereof having a permanent top;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any step or platform thereof forming part of any entrance or exit, other than an emergency exit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at least one lamp shall be provided as near as reasonably practicable to the top of every staircase leading to an upper deck thereof not having a permanent top; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: all lighting circuits shall be so arranged that an electrical failure of any lighting sub-circuit shall not be capable of extinguishing all the lights on any deck thereof.

subsection.content: Adequate internal lighting shall be provided in every light bus for the illumination of the light bus and any step or platform thereof forming part of any entrance or exit, other than an emergency exit, and all lighting circuits shall be so arranged that an electrical failure of any lighting sub-circuit shall not be capable of extinguishing all the lights therein.
All electrical apparatus and circuits in every bus and light bus shall be so constructed and installed as to guard adequately against the risk of electric shock and the outbreak of fire.

Subject to paragraph (3), where the voltage exceeds 100 volts in one or more electrical circuits in a bus or light bus, a manually operated isolating switch which is capable of disconnecting all such circuits from the main electrical supply shall be connected in each pole of that supply which is not electrically connected to earth, and shall be located inside the bus or light bus in a position readily accessible to the driver or conductor.
No isolating switch fitted under paragraph (2) shall be capable of disconnecting any electrical circuit supplying the lamps required to be carried under Part VII of these regulations.
In this regulation any reference to an electrical circuit is a reference to an electrical circuit not being a high tension ignition circuit or a circuit within a unit of equipment.

subsection.leadIn: In every bus and light bus—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the top of the tread of the lowest step provided at any entrance or exit, other than an emergency exit, shall be not more than 450 millimetres nor less than 250 millimetres above the ground when the vehicle is empty;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all steps shall be fitted with non-slip treads; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: fixed steps shall be not less than 230 millimetres in depth and shall in no case project laterally beyond the body of the vehicle unless they are so protected by the front wings of the vehicle or otherwise that they are not liable to injure pedestrians.

subsection.leadIn: In every bus—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any rear platform shall be not more than 450 millimetres nor less than 250 millimetres above the ground when the vehicle is empty;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the outer edge of any rear platform shall be fitted with non-slip treads; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: risers shall not be more than 270 millimetres in height.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to paragraph (1), in the case of a double-decked bus—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the risers of all steps leading from the lower to the upper deck shall be closed and no unguarded aperture shall be left at the top landing board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all steps leading from the lower to the upper deck shall be fitted with non-slip treads;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the horizontal distance from the nearest point of the riser of the top step to the vertical line passing through the nearest point of the seat opposite to the top tread of the staircase, excluding any grab rail which does not project more than 200 millimetres from the back of the seat, shall not be less than 600 millimetres; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the outer stringer of an outside staircase shall be so constructed, or a band shall be so placed, as to act as a screen to persons ascending or descending, and the height of the outer guard rail shall not be less than 1.2 metres above the front of the tread of each step.

subsection.content: The deck of every bus shall be fitted with a non-slip surface.

Subject to paragraphs (2) and (3), a bus which has a seating capacity not exceeding 45 passengers shall be provided with 2 exits so placed as not to be on the same side of the bus and one of which may be a primary emergency exit but neither of which shall be a secondary emergency exit.

Paragraph (1) shall not apply in the case of a bus which has a seating capacity exceeding 23 passengers and which is provided with an exit by virtue of its having a rear platform which communicates with a deck (being, in the case of a double-decked bus, the lower deck) by means of a doorless opening and has a doorless opening on the near side of the bus continuous with another such opening at the rear of the bus, that opening serving together as a means of entrance to or exit from the bus.

subsection.leadIn: Where the exits provided in accordance with paragraph (1) are so placed that the distance between their centres is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a bus which has a seating capacity exceeding 23 passengers, less than 3 metres;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a bus which has a seating capacity not exceeding 23 passengers, less than 2.4 metres,

subsection.continued: a primary emergency exit or secondary emergency exit shall be provided and so placed that there is a distance of—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: in the case of a bus which has a seating capacity exceeding 23 passengers, not less than 3 metres; and

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: in the case of a bus which has a seating capacity not exceeding 23 passengers, not less than 2.4 metres,

subsection.continued: between the nearest points of the openings of that exit and one of the two exits required by paragraph (1).

subsection.leadIn: A bus which has a seating capacity exceeding 45 passengers shall be provided with 3 exits which shall comply with the following requirements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: one of the exits may be a secondary emergency exit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 2 of the exits (neither being a secondary emergency exit) shall be so placed as not to be on the same side of the bus;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where 2 exits are placed on the same side of the bus, the distance between their centres shall not be less than 3 metres; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: one of the exits (not being a secondary emergency exit) shall be placed at the front end of the bus so that the distance between its centre and the foremost part of the bus is not more than 3 metres and another of the exits (not being a secondary emergency exit) shall be placed at the rear end of the bus so that the distance between its centre and the rearmost part of the bus is not more than 3 metres.

subsection.content: In the case of a half-decked bus, an emergency exit of dimensions not less than 1 500 millimetres by 450 millimetres shall be provided in the roof of the bus and so placed that the transverse centre line of that exit lies within 600 millimetres of the mid-point between the front edges of the foremost and of the rearmost passenger seats in the bus.

Where, in the case of a double-decked bus which has a permanent top, access to the upper deck is obtained by means of an enclosed staircase, an emergency exit of dimensions not less than 1 500 millimetres by 450 millimetres shall be provided on that deck and placed otherwise than on the near side of the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: Every entrance provided in a bus shall be placed on the near side of the bus, but one or more entrances may be provided on the off side of the bus if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in respect of any entrance so provided it is not also an exit provided in accordance with any of the foregoing provisions in this regulation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every such entrance is fitted with a door which can be controlled only by the driver while sitting in his seat; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the device available to the driver for opening or closing that door is a separate and readily distinguishable device from that available to the driver for opening or closing any door fitted to the near side of the bus:

subsection.proviso: Provided that this paragraph shall not apply in the case of a bus referred to in paragraph (2).

subsection.content: Handrails shall be fitted on each side of every entrance and exit provided in a bus (other than an emergency exit) to assist passengers to board or alight from the vehicle.

subsection.leadIn: The width of every entrance and exit provided in a bus (other than the secondary emergency exit or an emergency exit provided in accordance with paragraphs (5) and (6)) shall be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: not less than 500 millimetres; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of an exit which serves both decks of a double-decked bus (disregarding any stanchion), being an exit which is either—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the only such exit in the bus; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the exit most readily and directly associated with a staircase serving the upper deck,

subsection.proviso: Provided that this paragraph shall not apply in the case of an exit referred to in paragraph (2) if the width of that exit measured along the side of the bus is not less than 500 millimetres and its width measured along the rear of the bus is not less than 450 millimetres.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: references to the seating capacity of a vehicle shall, in the case of a double-decked bus, be treated as references to the seating capacity of its lower deck;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: references to the distance between the centres or between the nearest points of the openings of 2 exits in a bus are references to the distance between lines drawn at right-angles to the longitudinal axis of the bus and passing respectively through the centres or, as the case may be, the nearest points of the openings of the exits at gangway level; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reference to the distance between the centre of an exit placed at the front end of a bus and the foremost part of the bus is a reference to the distance between lines drawn at right-angles to the longitudinal axis of the bus and passing through the centre of that exit and the said foremost part and the reference to the distance between the centre of an exit placed at the rear end of a bus and the rearmost part of the bus is a reference to the distance between lines drawn as aforesaid and passing through the centre of that exit and the said rearmost part.

subsection.content: A bus shall not be treated as failing to comply with this regulation by reason only that a number of exits are provided in excess of the number specified in relation to it by this regulation.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Entrances and exits on light buses

subsection.leadIn: There must be at least 2 exits (one of which may be an emergency exit) on a light bus, and the exits must be situated on at least 2 of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the near side of the light bus;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the off side of the light bus;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the rear of the light bus. (L.N. 164 of 2021)
